results.title: Thailand
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Don Murray, John Temple, Roan Hannam, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”
A look at the historical and cultural background of Thailand. Focuses on the respect the Thais have for the monks and their religion, and the veneration of the monarchy.

results.title: Hong Kong, Singapore: fragrant harbour, lion city
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and Queensland University of Technology
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the cultural background of Hong Kong and Singapore. Both places are governed by the professional elite ruling class. However, they have produced very different societies under the pressure of history and circumstances. Sujitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Asian highway
results.creator_credit: Akira Taketomi, Ivan Chapman, Shizuo Kimura, ABC and Japan Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: The story of the transformation of the world’s oldest road into a modern all-weather motor highway. The ancient caravan route stretches 8,000 miles across Asia from the Iranian-Turkish border to East Pakistan. Work started in 1958 and when completed modern asphalt or concrete roads will stretch almost halfway across Asia, linking up with European highway networks. It will serve an area where more than 600 million people live. Shows the people who live along the highway, their way of life, and their emergence from seclusion.

results.title: Asian crescent
results.creator_credit: Peter Hopkinson, James Carr and Lever Brothers
results.brief_description: A look at some of the social and economic problems facing the Malaysian Federation. Although born in Malaysia the people may be Chinese, Indian, Malay, with different languages, religions and ways of life. The federation is determined to give equality of opportunity and a real sense of natural unity to all its people.

results.title: Asian artists in crystals
results.brief_description: Describes an exhibit of American crystalware engraved with designs created by sixteen artists representing Burma, Ceylon, China, Egypt, India, Indonesia, Iran, Iraq, Japan, Korea, Pakistan, the Philippines, Syria, Thailand, Turkey, and Vietnam. Shows the work of these artists, how American designers captured the mood of the drawings in crystal form, and how American craftsmen translated the drawings into engravings.

results.title: Asia: two thirds and counting
results.creator_credit: Edward Magruder Jones and United Nations Films
results.brief_description: Asia now has almost two-thirds of the world’s people and may double its total by the year 2000. India, China and Japan have approached the problem of overpopulation in three different ways, eg India initially tried massive birth control, but is now attacking poverty as the main source of its problems. China has always done this, with success. Japan now has little increase, but faces other problems. The approach of each country is examined and the long-term effects of the action taken are discussed.

results.title: Ashes and diamonds
results.brief_description: The third part of a massive trilogy dedicated to the youth of Poland in the Second World War. In this extract the action takes place in the late afternoon preceeding the Communist liberation. The hero, Maciek, leads the resistance group, which owes allegiance to the Polish National Government exiled in London. His orders are to assassinate the new Communist District Secretary, Szczuka. Based on the book “Ashes and diamonds” by Jerzy Andrzejewski.

results.title: Asexual reproduction
results.brief_description: Describes asexual reproduction processes and shows how they differ from those of sexual reproduction. Develops three concepts: that all types of asexual reproduction are basically alike, asexually reproduced offspring are like the parents, and there is no fusion of gametes. Illustrates examples of simple fission in microscopic plants and animals and budding in various plants. No other credits available.

results.title: Asep in action: the teacher (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Contains interviews with teachers on their reactions to A.S.E.P.. They discuss the applicability of A.S.E.P. courses for slow learners through to above average learners. Discusses problems of obtaining the necessary materials and the time required in preparation, followed by demonstrations of the course in classroom situations.

results.title: Asep in action: the student (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows students using the unit “Plants” in the classroom and on an excursion, emphasizing the practical aspects of A.S.E.P. courses, whilst participating in excursions, they discus teacher/student relationships, and their feelings about group work and electives.
